demolition

Class GameMechanics

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.GameMechanics

  • public class GameMechanics
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the mechanics of the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean refresh
      Signals the app to update the map configurations and characters when the Player has passed a level.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameMechanics()
      Creates a new GameMechanics object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void config(PApplet app, java.lang.String pathname)
      Load the game configurations (map layout and initial time of each level, max lives of the Player) from the given configuration .json file.
      void draw(PApplet app)
      Draws the game end on-screen text.
      void gameOver()
      Signals game over
      int getCurrentLevel()
      Returns current level.
      BomberMap getCurrentMap()
      Returns BomberMap object of the current level.
      UI getCurrentUI()
      Returns the UI object of the current level.
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the Player object created.
      java.util.List<RedEnemy> getReds()
      Returns the list of RedEnemy objects created.
      java.util.List<YellowEnemy> getYellows()
      Returns the list of YellowEnemy objects created.
      boolean isFinish()
      Returns if the game has ended (win/lose)
      boolean isRefreshed()
      Signals the app to refresh and update to new game configurations, initially false.
      void pass()
      Called when the Player passes a level.
      void setChar()
      Creates the in-game character objects (Player, RedEnemy, YellowEnemy) based on the map layout loaded in and add them into a list associated with the GameMechanics object.
      void tick()
      Logic of main game mechanics, which includes checking if the Player and enemies (RedEnemy and Yellowenemy objects) have crossed path, checking timer and Player life count (if timer reaches zero or the Player loses all its life, game ends), checking if the Player has passed a level (reaches Goal location) and signals refresh and update of game configurations.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • refresh

        public boolean refresh
        Signals the app to update the map configurations and characters when the Player has passed a level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameMechanics

        public GameMechanics()
        Creates a new GameMechanics object.

    • Method Detail

      • config

        public void config(PApplet app,
                   java.lang.String pathname)
        Load the game configurations (map layout and initial time of each level, max lives of the Player) from the given configuration .json file. Requires Papplet app.
        Parameters:
        app - App of the game
        pathname - Directory path of cnfiguration .json file.

      • setChar

        public void setChar()
        Creates the in-game character objects (Player, RedEnemy, YellowEnemy) based on the map layout loaded in and add them into a list associated with the GameMechanics object.

      • isRefreshed

        public boolean isRefreshed()
        Signals the app to refresh and update to new game configurations, initially false.
        Returns:
        if the game configurations need to be refreshed and updated.

      • getCurrentLevel

        public int getCurrentLevel()
        Returns current level. (For JUnit testing purposes only.)
        Returns:
        current level

      • getCurrentMap

        public BomberMap getCurrentMap()
        Returns BomberMap object of the current level.
        Returns:
        BomberMap object

      • getCurrentUI

        public UI getCurrentUI()
        Returns the UI object of the current level.
        Returns:
        UI object

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Returns the Player object created.
        Returns:
        Player object

      • getReds

        public java.util.List<RedEnemy> getReds()
        Returns the list of RedEnemy objects created.
        Returns:
        list of RedEnemy objects

      • getYellows

        public java.util.List<YellowEnemy> getYellows()
        Returns the list of YellowEnemy objects created.
        Returns:
        list of YellowEnemy objects

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        Signals game over

      • pass

        public void pass()
        Called when the Player passes a level. If all levels were passed, signals the Player won.

      • isFinish

        public boolean isFinish()
        Returns if the game has ended (win/lose)
        Returns:
        if the game has ended.

      • draw

        public void draw(PApplet app)
        Draws the game end on-screen text. Requires Papplet app.
        Parameters:
        app - App of the game.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Logic of main game mechanics, which includes checking if the Player and enemies (RedEnemy and Yellowenemy objects) have crossed path, checking timer and Player life count (if timer reaches zero or the Player loses all its life, game ends), checking if the Player has passed a level (reaches Goal location) and signals refresh and update of game configurations.
